sen.j: だるま（達磨）は、仏教の1派である禅宗開祖の達磨の坐禅姿を模した置物、または玩具であり、現在では禅宗のみならず宗教、宗派を越え縁起物として広く親しまれている。
sen.e: The Daruma is a doll or a toy representing the figure of Daruma, who was practicing Zazen (Zen sitting meditation), and the founder of the Zen Buddhism, which is one of Buddhism sects; at the present time, it is widely popular as a lucky charm not only in the Zen sect, but also in different religious sects, across religions.

The Daruma is a doll or a toy representing the figure of Daruma, who practiced Zazen (Zen sitting meditation), and was the founder of the Zen Buddhism, which a sect of Buddhism; at the present time, it is widely popular as a lucky charm not only in the Zen sect, but also in different religious sects, across religions.

A daruma is a doll or toy representing the sitting figure of Bodhidharma, the founder of the Zen, a sect of Buddhism, who is practicing Zen meditation; at the present time, it is widely popular as a lucky charm not only in the Zen sect, but also in different religious sects, across religions.
sen.cmt: 達磨はa darumaとしました。

sen.j: 多くは張子（はりこ）で製作され、目の部分は書き入れずに空白のままに残す。
sen.e: Daruma dolls are usually made of papier-mâché and the eyes of them are left blank on purpose when sold.
Daruma dolls are usually made of papier-mâché and the eyes are left blank on purpose when sold.
Daruma dolls are usually made of papier-mâché and the eyes are left blank on purpose when sold.

sen.j: そして何らかの祈願を行い、祈願が叶うと目を書き入れるという習慣がある。
sen.e: There is a custom that the purchaser paints in one eye, making some special wish and paints in the other eye when the wish is fulfilled.
There is a custom where the purchaser paints in one eye, making some special wish and paints in the other eye when the wish is fulfilled.
Traditionally, the purchaser paints in one eye, making some special wish, and when the wish is fulfilled, paints in the other eye.

sen.j: 玩具の1つに、底が丸く重心が低く作られていることによって倒しても起き上がる起き上がり小法師（不倒翁）という物がある。
sen.e: A prototype of a Daruma doll was okiagari-koboshi, a toy (a tumble doll), which is weighted at the rounded bottom in a way that it returns to an upright position when tipped over.
sen.cmt: 達磨の起源についてのtopic sentenseなので、a prototype of a Daruma doll を補足しました。
sen.e: A prototype to the Daruma doll was okiagari-koboshi, a toy (a tumble doll), which is weighted at the rounded bottom in a way that it returns to an upright position when tipped over.
A prototype to a daruma doll is a tumble doll (okiagari-koboshi), which is weighted at the round bottom in a way that it returns to an upright position when tipped over.

sen.j: その何度でも起き上がる様子が、達磨の面壁九年という坐禅をし続けた逸話に見立てられ、達磨の顔が描かれるようになった。
sen.e: This roly-poly doll which always stands up was compared to the anecdote which was symbolic of Daruma's persistence in nine-year menpi (wall-gazing, a type of meditation being ascribed to Daruma) and then the face of Daruma was painted on that doll.

This roly-poly doll which always stands up was compared to the anecdote which was symbolic of Daruma's persistence during his nine-year menpi (wall-gazing, a type of meditation being ascribed to Daruma), after which the face of Daruma was painted on the doll.

This roly-poly doll which always stands up was compared to the anecdote of Bodhidharma's persistence during his nine-year Zen meditation of wall-gazing, after which the face of Bodhidharma was painted on the doll.
sen.cmt: 達磨（人物）はBodhidharmaとしました。

sen.j: そしてこの「起き上がり」「七転八起」と言う特性から、次第に縁起物とされるようになった。
sen.e: The characteristics of this doll, such as "oki-agari (get up and arise)" and "nanakorobi-yaoki (the vicissitudes of life, ups and downs in life, always rising after a fall or repeated failures)," gradually made it a lucky charm.

The characteristics of this doll, such as "oki-agari (get up and arise)" and "nanakorobi-yaoki (the vicissitudes of life, ups and downs in life, always rising after a fall or repeated failures)," gradually made it a lucky charm.
These characteristics of a daruma doll, such as 'standing up again' (okiagari) and 'stumbling seven imes but recovering eight' (nanakorobi-yaoki), gradually made it a lucky charm.

sen.j: 日本では、江戸時代に中国から長崎の黄檗宗の寺院に伝来したのが起源とされている。
sen.e: In Japan, the introduction of Daruma dolls to the temples of the Obaku sect of Buddhism in Nagasaki from China during the Edo period is said to be the origin of these dolls.
In Japan, the introduction of Daruma dolls to the temples of the Obaku sect of Buddhism in Nagasaki from China during the Edo period is said to be the origin of these dolls.
In Japan, the origin of daruma dolls is said to be during the Edo period when they were introduced from China to the temples of the Obaku sect in Nagasaki.

sen.j: その後、商人に信仰され、日本各地に普及していったのである。
sen.e: After that, they were worshiped by merchants, and spread to various places in Japan.
After that, they were worshiped by merchants, and spread to various places in Japan.
After that, they were worshiped by merchants, and spread to various places in Japan.

sen.j: ちなみに、長崎伝来時のだるまの色は黄色であったと伝えられている。
sen.e: Incidentally, the color of Daruma dolls introduced to Nagasaki is believed to have been yellow.
Incidentally, the color of Daruma dolls introduced to Nagasaki is believed to have been yellow.
Incidentally, the color of daruma dolls introduced to Nagasaki is believed to have been yellow.

sen.j: だるまは古来より、赤色を基調とした塗装が行われることがほとんどであった。
sen.e: Basically, Daruma dolls have been painted red from ancient times.
Basically, Daruma dolls have been painted red from ancient times.
Basically, daruma dolls have been painted red from ancient times.

sen.j: これは達磨が赤い衣を着ていたとされる事に由来するが、その他に、赤色には魔除けの効果があると信じられていた事や、疱瘡を引き起こす疱瘡神が、赤色を嫌うと信じられていた事からも由来しているのではないかとされている。
sen.e: It is said that this red coloring was derived from the red robes which Daruma wore, or from other facts that red color was believed to dispel evil spirits or that Hoso Kami (a god of smallpox) bringing smallpox was also believed to hate the color of red.

It is said that this red coloring was derived from the red robes which Daruma wore, or from other facts that the red color was believed to dispel evil spirits or that Hoso Kami (a god of smallpox) bringing smallpox was also believed to hate the color of red.

This red coloring is derived from an old saying that Bodhidharma wore a red robe, but there are other sayings that the red color could dispel evil spirits, or that the god of smallpox who causes smallpox would hate the color of red.
sen.cmt: 左記のように変更しました。

sen.j: 以上の事から、だるまは疱瘡除け・魔除けの力がある玩具として子供に与えられた。
sen.e: For these reasons, Daruma dolls were given children as a toy which had magical power to protect them against smallpox and evil spirits.
For these reasons, Daruma dolls were given to children as a toy which had magical powers in order to protect them against smallpox and evil spirits.
For these reasons, daruma dolls were given to children as a toy which had magical powers in order to protect them against smallpox and evil spirits.

sen.j: なお近年では、赤色以外にも、黄色、白色、緑色、金色等の色を基調としただるまも製造されている。
sen.e: In recent years, these dolls have been produced in yellow, white, green, and gold besides red.
In recent years, these dolls have been produced in yellow, white, green, and gold besides red.

tit.e: Filling in eyes of Daruma and discrimination against the disabled
Filling in eyes of Daruma and discrimination against the disabled
Filling in eyes of a daruma doll and discrimination against the disabled

sen.j: 上述の通りだるまは、何らかの祈願が達成すると目入れをするが、だるまは縁起物、拝むものとしての側面を持っているために、仏像と同じく「開眼」する必要がある。
sen.e: As mentioned above, purchasers follow the custom that they paint in eyes of Daruma after the fulfillment of some special wish; however, another aspect that Daruma dolls are charms and subjects of worship requires that the "eyes-opening" ceremony should be done to Daruma as it should to Buddhist sculptures.

As mentioned above, purchasers follow the custom that they paint in the eyes of a Daruma after the fulfillment of some special wish; however, another aspect is that Daruma dolls are charms and subjects of worship that require that the "eyes-opening" ceremony be done to Daruma according to Buddhist sculptures.

As mentioned above, a purchaser paints in an eye of a daruma doll after the fulfillment of some special wish; however, daruma dolls are charms and objects of worship that require 'eyes-opening' (spiritual awakening) in the same manner as Buddhist images.
sen.cmt: darumaを小文字にしました。開眼に説明を補足しました。

sen.j: そのため、祈願者が願いを込めながら向かって右に目を入れ「半開眼」し、願いが叶ったらもう片目を入れる。
sen.e: For this ceremony, those who set a goal paint in one eye on the right from the viewer's perspective while wishing for help in achieving that goal, one-eye-open, and then color in the other eye when the goal is achieved, eyes-opening.

For this ceremony, those who set a goal paint in one eye on the right from the viewer's perspective while wishing for help in achieving that goal, leaving it with one-eye-open, and then color in the other eye when the goal is achieved, making it eyes-opened.
For this ceremony, making a wish, a prayer paints in one eye on the right (half-awakening), and when the wish is granted, color in the other eye.

sen.j: そのため、初めから開眼の済んでいるだるまではこの儀式が行えないために目を入れずに売られているのである。
sen.e: If the eyes of Daruma dolls have been already painted in, the purchasers can not perform this ceremony, so that Daruma dolls are sold with their eyes left blank.
If the eyes of Daruma dolls have been already painted in, the purchasers can not perform this ceremony, so that Daruma dolls are sold with their eyes left blank.
If the eyes of daruma dolls have been already painted in, the purchasers can not perform this ceremony, so that daruma dolls are sold with their eyes left blank.

sen.j: しかし、一方で障害者差別に繋がるという主張があるが、だるまに関する正確な知識が流布していないことによる思い違いである。
sen.e: However, the claim that the practice of making Daruma without eyes is discriminatory against the blind might be misconception in which the lack of the accurate knowledge about Daruma results.

However, the claim that the practice of making Daruma without eyes is discriminatory against the blind could be said to be a misconception resulting from a lack of accurate knowledge about the Daruma.

sen.j: が、この主張に配慮し現在では公に目入れをする機会は減っており、最初から目が入っているだるまも多く売られるようになって来ている。
sen.e: At the present time, nonetheless, there are fewer chances to see some people draw an eye of Daruma in public out of consideration for that claim, so that many Daruma dolls with their eyes painted in beforehand have come to be sold.

At the present time, nonetheless, there are fewer chances to see people draw an eye into a Daruma out in public due to the claim that many Daruma dolls are now sold with their eyes painted in beforehand.

sen.j: 「五色願かけだるま」は、仏教における宇宙の五元素、五大「空風火水土」を象徴する色「青、黄、赤、白、黒」を五色に塗り分けた京だるま。
sen.e: The 'Goshiki Gankake Daruma' is a Kyo-Daruma doll (made in Kyoto) painted in five color variation, 'blue, yellow, red, white, black,' representing five basic elements, also called Godai (five elements), of the universe in Buddhism; 'void, air, fire, water, and earth.'

The 'Goshiki Gankake Daruma' is a Kyo-Daruma doll (made in Kyoto) painted in five color variations, 'blue, yellow, red, white, black,' representing five basic elements, also called Godai (five elements), of the universe in Buddhism; 'void, air, fire, water, and earth.'

The 'Goshiki Gankake Daruma' is a Kyoto-type daruma doll painted in five color variations, 'blue, yellow, red, white, black,' representing five basic elements, 'sky, wind, fire, water, earth' respectively, which are five elements of the universe in Buddhism.

sen.j: 願い事を開運札に書いてだるまに貼るのが特徴。

sen.j: 「武州だるま」とも呼ばれ、江戸時代の享保年間（1716～1736年）に、間久里の「だる吉」という人形師が、従来あった「起き上がり小法師」という玩具に座禅を組んだ達磨大師を描いたのが起源といわれている。
sen.e: Also called as 'Bushu Daruma', the Koshigaya Daruma doll is said to have originated from a toy, previously known as okiagari koboshi, on which a doll maker in Akuri, named 'Darukichi,' painted the face of Darumadaishi in meditation during the Kyoho area of the Edo period (1716～1736).

Also called 'Bushu Daruma', the Koshigaya Daruma doll is said to have originated from a toy, previously known as okiagari koboshi, on which a doll maker in Akuri, named 'Darukichi,' painted the face of Darumadaishi in meditation during the Kyoho area of the Edo period (1716～1736).

Also called 'Bushu Daruma', the Koshigaya Daruma doll is said to have originated from a toy, previously known as okiagari koboshi, on which a doll maker in Makuri, named 'Darukichi,' painted the face of Bodhidharma in meditation during the Kyoho era in the Edo period (1716～1736).

sen.j: 他に比べて「色白」「鼻高」「福福しい」という特徴があり、川崎大師や柴又帝釈天など関東一円をはじめ、全国に広く出荷され「越谷だるま」の名で知られている。
sen.e: Compared with other Daruma dolls, they have facial features, 'fair complexion,' 'high nasal height,' and 'auspicious expression,' and are shipped all around the nation, especially throughout the Kanto region including Kawasaki-daishi Temple, and Taishakuten Temple, known by the name of 'Koshigaya Daruma.'

Compared with other daruma dolls, they have facial features, 'fair complexion,' 'high nasal height,' and 'auspicious expression,' and are shipped all around the nation, especially throughout the Kanto region including Kawasaki-daishi Temple, and Taishakuten Temple, known by the name of 'Koshigaya Daruma.'

sen.j: 越谷市だるま組合の越谷市の7軒、さいたま市（岩槻区）1軒、春日部市1軒により年間約40万個のだるまが生産されているが、そのほとんどが手作業によるもの。
sen.e: Four hundred thousand Koshigaya Daruma dolls are produced every year by seven Daruma doll makers of Koshigaya City which belong to Daruma associations in Koshigaya City, one in Saitama City (Iwatsuki Ward), and one in Kasukabe City; almost all of these dolls are produced by hand.

Four hundred thousand Koshigaya Daruma dolls are produced every year by seven Daruma doll makers of Koshigaya City which belong to Daruma associations in Koshigaya City, one in Saitama City (Iwatsuki Ward), and one in Kasukabe City; almost all of these dolls are produced by hand.

Four hundred thousand Koshigaya Daruma dolls are produced every year by seven Daruma doll makers of Koshigaya City which belong to Daruma associations in Koshigaya City, one in Saitama City (Iwatsuki Ward), and one in Kasukabe City; almost all of these dolls are produced by hand.

sen.j: 神功皇后に由来するだるま体型の人形。
sen.e: The hime Daruma is a doll shaped like a Daruma doll, derived from the Empress Jingu.
The hime Daruma is a doll shaped like a Daruma doll, derived from the Empress Jingu.
Hime Daruma is a doll shaped like a daruma doll, derived from the Empress Jingu.

sen.j: 愛媛県が発祥の地。
sen.e: Ehime Prefecture is the birthplace of these dolls.
Ehime Prefecture is the birthplace of these dolls.
Ehime Prefecture is the birthplace of these dolls.

sen.j: 大分県竹田市などでも生産されている。
sen.e: They are also produced in Takeda City, Oita Prefecture.
They are also produced in Takeda City, Oita Prefecture.
They are also produced in Takeda City, Oita Prefecture.

sen.j: だるまを販売する市が、だるま市として毎年各地で開催されている。
sen.e: Daruma fairs, where Daruma dolls are sold, are held in various places every year.
Daruma fairs, where Daruma dolls are sold, are held in various places every year.
Daruma fairs, where Daruma dolls are sold, are held in various places every year.

Bishamonten Festival

sen.e: Bishamonten Festival is held from January 7 to 9 by the lunar-solar calendar at Myoho-ji Temple (Fuji City) in Fuji City, Shizuoka Prefecture.
Bishamonten Festival is held from January 7 to 9 by the lunar-solar calendar at Myoho-ji Temple (Fuji City) in Fuji City, Shizuoka Prefecture.
Bishamonten Festival is held from 7th to 9th of the lunar New Year at Myoho-ji Temple in Fuji City, Shizuoka Prefecture.

sen.j: 毎年50万の人出があり日本一の規模。

tit.j: だるまから派生したもの

sen.j: 弾丸の先端に形状が似ただるまの下に、薄い円柱を数段重ね、それを横から1段ずつ木槌で叩いて抜き、倒れないようにうまく一番上のだるまを落とすという玩具・遊びである。
sen.e: The Daruma otoshi is a toy or a game consisting of stacked several thin circular pieces with a Daruma doll similar to a tip of a bullet on top that players knock one by one without toppling the doll using the wooden mallet.

The Daruma otoshi is a toy or a game consisting several thin circular pieces stacked with a Daruma doll similar to a tip of a bullet on top where players knock one by one without toppling the doll using the wooden mallet.

Daruma otoshi is a toy consisting several thin circular pieces stacked up with a daruma doll similar to a tip of a bullet on top, where players knock disks one by one from the flank with an wooden mallet without toppling the disk tower, and the winner of the game is the person who can remove all disks only remaining a daruma doll on the floor.
sen.cmt: 左記のように変更しました。

sen.j: 胴を素早くたたくのがコツである。
sen.e: It is a secret to hit the center pieces out as fast as possible.
Hitting the center pieces out as fast as possible is a technique used to achieve this.
Hitting out disks in the flank quickly is a knack of it.
sen.cmt: 左記のように変更しました。

tit.j: だるまさんがころんだ
tit.e: Daruma-san ga koronda (The Bodhidharm fell down)

sen.j: こどもの文化の一種。
sen.e: Daruma-san ga koronda is a kind of children culture.
Daruma-san ga koronda is a kind of children culture.
Daruma-san ga koronda is a kind of children culture.

sen.j: 鬼ごっこの変種と考えられる。
sen.e: It is thought to be a variation of the game of tag.
It is thought to be a variation of the game of tag.
It is thought to be a variation of the game of tag.

sen.j: 鬼がその他の参加者に背中を向けて「だるまさんがころんだ」を唱える間に、他の参加者が鬼に触れ、より遠くへ逃げることを目的とする。
sen.e: The purpose of the game is that while the tagger calls out 'daruma-san ga koronda' with his or her back to the rest of the players, the others touch the tagger and then run away as far as they can towards the tagger.

The purpose of the game is that while the tagger calls out 'daruma-san ga koronda' with his or her back to the rest of the players, the others touch the tagger and then run away as far as they can towards the tagger.

The details of this game is that while the tagger calls out 'daruma-san ga koronda' (Bodhidharm fell down) with his or her back to the rest of the players, the others touch the tagger and then run away as far as they can from the tagger.
sen.cmt: 左記のように変更しました。

sen.j: また、鬼が呪文を唱えているとき以外は他の参加者は身動きの一切を禁じられる。
sen.e: At any time, except for when the tagger is calling out the spell, 'Daruma-san ga koronda,' the players must freeze in place.
At any time, except for when the tagger is calling out the spell, 'Daruma-san ga koronda,' the players must freeze in place.
At any time when the tagger is calling out the spell, 'Daruma-san ga koronda,' the players must freeze in place.
sen.cmt: 左記のように変更しました。

tit.e: Niramekko (staring-out (down) game, game in which two children looking at each other try to make the opponents make laugh first)
Niramekko (staring-out (down) game, game in which two children looking at each other try to make the opponents make laugh first)

sen.j: 二人が顔を見合わせ、笑いを我慢する。
sen.e: Two children look at each other and stand to laugh.
Two children look at each other and try to keep from laughing.
Two children look at each other and try to keep from laughing.

sen.j: この時、「だるまさんだるまさん、にらめっこしましょ」とかけ声をかける。
sen.e: In starting the game, they call out, 'Daruma-san, Daruma-san, niramekko shimasho.'
In starting the game, they call out, 'Daruma-san, Daruma-san, niramekko shimasho.'
In starting the game, they call out, 'Daruma-san, Daruma-san, niramekko shimasho.'

sen.j: 高崎駅の有名な駅弁に高崎弁当だるま弁当というのがある。
sen.e: There is a famous ekiben (box lunch sold at railway stations) in Takasaki Station, called Takasaki Bento Daruma Bento (Lunch Box).
There is a famous ekiben (box lunch sold at railway stations) in Takasaki Station, called Takasaki Bento Daruma Bento (Lunch Box).
There is a famous ekiben (box lunch sold at railway stations) in Takasaki Station, called Takasaki Bento Daruma Bento (Lunch Box).

sen.j: 高崎市がだるま製造で有名なことを受けて、だるま型の容器に白ご飯を敷き、その上におかずを載せたもの。
sen.e: Because Takasaki City is famous for the Daruma doll productive area, Daruma-shaped containers are used for a Daruma bento consisting of several small portions of food on cooked rice.
Because Takasaki City is famous for producing Daruma dolls, Daruma-shaped containers are used for a Daruma bento consisting of several small portions of food on cooked rice.
Because Takasaki City is famous for producing Daruma dolls, Daruma-shaped containers are used for a Daruma bento consisting of several small portions of food on cooked rice.

sen.j: レギュラー版は「高崎だるま」に似たプラスチック容器を用いているが、古いだるま弁当を再現した「復刻だるま弁当」は瀬戸物の眼光鋭い達磨の表情を描いた容器となっており、全く別の造形である。
sen.e: There are two totally different types of containers of Daruma Bento; the plastic containers, regular version, similar to a 'Takasaki Daruma doll' in shape and the containers made of china on which Daruma face with sharp eyes are depicted, called 'revived Daruma bento,' reproducing old Daruma bento.

There are two totally different types of containers of Daruma Bento; the plastic containers, regular version, similar to a 'Takasaki Daruma doll' in shape and the containers made of china on which Daruma face with sharp eyes are depicted, called 'revived Daruma bento,' reproducing old Daruma bento.

There are two totally different types of containers of Daruma Bento; the plastic containers, regular version, similar to a 'Takasaki Daruma doll' in shape and the containers made of china on which Daruma face with sharp eyes are depicted, called 'revived Daruma bento,' reproducing old Daruma bento.

tit.j: ダルマ (ダルマ蔵相/ダルマ宰相)

sen.j: - 大正・昭和の政治家であった高橋是清の愛称。
sen.e: It was a nickname for Korekiyo TAKAHASHI, a politician during the Taisho and Showa era.
It was a nickname for Korekiyo TAKAHASHI, a politician during the Taisho and Showa era.
It was a nickname for Korekiyo TAKAHASHI, a politician during the Taisho and Showa era.

sen.j: その体格に因む。
sen.e: It was because his physique was similar to that of a Daruma doll.
It was because his physique was similar to that of a Daruma doll.
It was because his physique was similar to that of a daruma doll.

tit.e: Daruma stove (pot-bellied wood stove, Japanese traditional wood stove)
Daruma stove (pot-bellied wood stove, Japanese traditional wood stove)

sen.j: - 薪ストーブの1つ。
sen.e: The Daruma stove is a type of wood stove.
The Daruma stove is a type of wood stove.
The Daruma stove is a type of wood stove.

sen.j: 薪を入れる中央部分が膨らんでおり、その形状がだるまに似ている事に因む。
sen.e: Being round with a bulge in the middle for the loading door, Daruma stove is named for its Daruma-like shape,

sen.j: - サントリーのウイスキーの1つ、サントリーオールドの愛称。
sen.e: Daruma is a nickname for Suntory Old Whiskey, one kind of whiskey Suntory company has produced.

sen.j: ボトルの形状に因む。

sen.j: バー (酒場)等で呼称される。

sen.j: たぬきと呼ばれる事もある。
sen.e: It is sometimes called as 'tanuki (raccoon dog).'

tit.j: だるま女・中国奥地の達者
tit.e: Daruma woman (a woman without arms and legs) or those who live in the inland of China and do everything well even with no arms and legs.
tit.cmt: 列の位置がずれていました。

sen.j: - 都市伝説の一つ。
sen.e: The Daruma woman is one of urban legends.

tit.e: Darumouse (a compound word of Daruma and mouse)
Darumouse (a compound word of Daruma and mouse)
Darumouse (a compound word of Daruma and mouse)

sen.j: - だるまにマウス機能を内蔵したマウス、本物の高崎だるまを使用している事に因む。
sen.e: The Darumouse is named for the use of a real Takasaki Daruma doll with a built-in mouse.
